channel.title: Programming at night?
channel.description:
Right now it's 3:01 AM and I've been programming like super well this night. I don't know why, but maybe it's because I'm tired and my mind only thinks about one thing; how to fix the errors or how this method would be built, etc... In the daytime I have other things to think about and I usually also give up on my projects in the daytime. This sums up what I did in like 6 hours this night: (my eyes are hella tired too)
Released blank client Released 578 deob client (yay4me) Got 525 working Got 525 shops working (converted Z508 tutorial to Z525, wasn't too difficult but it is different...) Wrote a huge 5 chapter informational java thread
I had more I just can't think of it right now lol, maybe I'll remember in the morning.
Have any of you tried this? If not, try it. I think it helps me focus more.
EDIT: Oh wow 4 hrs 53 mins and I just registered at like 9:00 PM o.O

item.title: Programming at night?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I was up until 6:30 AM this morning, went to sleep, and woke up at around 12. Stayed on IRC and talked to noobs.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming at night?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:21, topic:322293”][quote author=Lin link=topic=418685.msg3080521#msg3080521 date=1262122800]
At night is one of my favorite times to do things, because no one is up at my house and I don’t have to worry about interruptions. But, normally I’ll get stuck on a problem and go to bed. The following morning I’ll get up and take a shower and get back to it and be able to fix the problem very easily.
[/quote]
I remmember over the summer when me and you were up all night on msn and i was making http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,381920.0.html and you were making your interface maker :P[/quote]That was hell >_< I can’t stand staying up a full night without getting sleep and then continuing the day. Also, I was working on my first useful application in C++ (The Spriting Tool), which never got finished

Read full topic

item.title: Programming at night?
item.dc:creator: @Nubz Nubz
item.description:
@Nubz wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:19, topic:322293”][quote author=Nubz link=topic=418685.msg3079688#msg3079688 date=1262065718]

[quote author=Espeon link=topic=418685.msg3077034#msg3077034 date=1261902209]

Right now it’s 3:01 AM and I’ve been programming like super well this night. I don’t know why, but maybe it’s because I’m tired and my mind only thinks about one thing; how to fix the errors or how this method would be built, etc… In the daytime I have other things to think about and I usually also give up on my projects in the daytime. This sums up what I did in like 6 hours this night: (my eyes are hella tired too)

Released blank client
Released 578 deob client (yay4me)
Got 525 working
Got 525 shops working (converted Z508 tutorial to Z525, wasn’t too difficult but it is different…)
Wrote a huge 5 chapter informational java thread

I had more I just can’t think of it right now lol, maybe I’ll remember in the morning.

Have any of you tried this? If not, try it. I think it helps me focus more.
[/quote]Tbh you didn’t really work on the deob because it was originally someone elses you just added models etc changed name and deleted .java files etc… anyways good job.

Added 377 cache, made it compatible with 317 deob, made moving water (which was easy meh), new emote system, extended emote + graphic list, but w/e
[/quote]It already had 377 cache in it, added by Kihomura because it was Kihomura’s client… Don’t leech it it’s not yours.

plenty of deobs out there faggot, there not all made by Kihomura.[/quote]No shit ;), I know because I had the exact same client.
@Frell, I love your “Rig”

Read full topic

item.title: Programming at night?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:14, topic:322293”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=418685.msg3077284#msg3077284 date=1261934539]

I don’t know why, but maybe it’s because I’m tired and my mind only thinks about one thing;
[/quote]That’s exactly what it is. Time and time again, through past experiences with coding, I’ve outdone myself during the night. Not even with just programming, but I’ve no-lifed with other projects as well at night. It’s all about focusing and having no interest in anything else, because what else is interesting at that time?

Porn. :|[/quote]
Ye what CJ said.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming at night?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Over the summer i worked on my 3d engine for about 20 hours straight, until it got physically impossible to look at the screen and not get side tracked by incoming dreams. I fell asleep in the chair for 4 hours then woke up and went back to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming at night?
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

I get in programming mindsets alot, too. Sometimes when I’m at school, I get ideas for an IRC bot or server, and I try and jot it down as best as I can. Usually when I get home and try to implement it, I forget how I really wanted to do it.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Nubz, post:4, topic:322293”][quote author=Espeon link=topic=418685.msg3077021#msg3077021 date=1261901064]
Right now it’s 3:01 AM and I’ve been programming like super well this night. I don’t know why, but maybe it’s because I’m tired and my mind only thinks about one thing; how to fix the errors or how this method would be built, etc… In the daytime I have other things to think about and I usually also give up on my projects in the daytime. This sums up what I did in like 6 hours this night: (my eyes are hella tired too)

Released blank client
Released 578 deob client (yay4me)
Got 525 working
Got 525 shops working (converted Z508 tutorial to Z525, wasn’t too difficult but it is different…)
Wrote a huge 5 chapter informational java thread

I had more I just can’t think of it right now lol, maybe I’ll remember in the morning.

Have any of you tried this? If not, try it. I think it helps me focus more.
[/quote]Tbh you didn’t really work on the deob because it was originally someone elses you just added models etc changed name and deleted .java files etc… anyways good job.[/quote]

Added 377 cache, made it compatible with 317 deob, made moving water (which was easy meh), new emote system, extended emote + graphic list, but w/e
